message.content:
Research UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform) in Adobe Premiere Pro:

1. What is the current state of UXP support in Premiere Pro?
2. What timeline/editing APIs does UXP provide?
3. What are the known limitations of UXP in Premiere Pro, specifically around razor/cut functionality?
4. Is there an official roadmap for UXP features in Premiere Pro?

Focus on official Adobe documentation and developer resources. Search the web for the latest 2024-2025 information about UXP in Premiere Pro.

Adobe UXP Premiere Pro timeline editing API documentation 2024
Adobe Premiere Pro UXP limitations razor cut functionality 2024

Based on my search, here's what I found about Adobe Premiere Pro UXP limitations regarding razor cut functionality:

## UXP Razor Tool Limitations

There is not yet any UXP API that mimics the razor tool. This is a confirmed limitation in the current UXP implementation for Premiere Pro.

### Key Findings:

**No Programmatic Razor/Cut Functionality:**
Developers looking to programmatically create cut sections, add markers to indicate which parts came from the original source, and place them in a new sequence cannot fully achieve this with UXP APIs.

**Markers and Metadata Limitation:**
In PPro, all markers and metadata associated with trackItems are actually attached to the backing projectItem; it's not possible to have different markers and metadata for each trackItem.(no content)This is the same for CEP+ExtendScript and UXP.

**What DOES Work in UXP:**
- Placing trackItems in a sequence = no problem. Export .srt file = no problem.
- You would use an output preset (.epr file) that specifies whatever settings you want.

### UXP Status for Premiere Pro:

UXP came to Premiere Pro in public beta on December 5th, 2024. This category is the best place to discuss UXP for Premiere Pro.(no content)The majority of what was possible via CEP+ExtendScript is now possible using UXP. However, the razor tool functionality was never available programmatically in either CEP/ExtendScript or UXP.

### Known Beta Limitations:
Limited Third-Party Support: Initial beta release may have limited support for specific third-party development workflows. Full support is expected in future updates. Spectrum Web Component support in UXP is not yet fully supported for Premiere Pro.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on my search, here's what I found about Adobe UXP Premiere Pro timeline editing API documentation:

## Adobe UXP for Premiere Pro - Overview

UXP (Unified eXtensibility Platform) is an integration framework built into Premiere and other Adobe Creative Cloud applications. It is powered by a modern JavaScript engine and offers the ability to access many Premiere functions at a programmatic level.

### Key Resources

1. **Official Documentation**: The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/

2. **Current Status**: As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so through September 2026.

3. **Version Information**: UXP is the next generation of APIs, for Premiere v25.6 and beyond.

### API Types Available

There are two main API types: UXP Core APIs for building user interfaces, file operations, network calls, and general functionality, and Premiere APIs for interacting with and modifying Premiere projects and sequences. Most often you will need to use both APIs together to create the functionality you want.

### Key Differences from ExtendScript

An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous, meaning they blocked the Premiere UI while executing. In UXP, method calls are asynchronous and do not block the UI thread. For a smooth transition, all properties (get and set) in the API were designed to be synchronous and do not need to be awaited.

### Timeline Editing Limitations

There is no current API method (DOM, QE, CEP, or UXP) that can move an existing clip vertically between tracks. Premiere Pro no longer includes a keyboard mappable command like "Move Clip Up/Down Between Tracks."(no content)The 'premiere_api' UXP example plugin, the right starting point for any future integrations, shows how to clone and remove track items.

### Recent API Updates (March 2025)

There have been updates for UXP APIs available in Premiere Pro Beta, including ClipProjectItem API for attaching proxy or high resolution footage, EncoderManager API for getting file extensions based on input sequence and preset, and SequenceEditor APIs.

### Sample Code & Development

The UXP Developer Tool is available for download through Creative Cloud Desktop. Adobe provides a third-party sample panel in the premiere-api directory from their Git repository.

For the complete official documentation, visit: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Here are the search results for Adobe Premiere Pro UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform) documentation:

## Official Adobe Documentation

UXP (Unified eXtensibility Platform) is an integration framework built into Premiere and other Adobe Creative Cloud applications. It is powered by a modern JavaScript engine and offers the ability to access many Premiere functions at a programmatic level.(no content)The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/.

## Key Details

### Current Status
The Unified Extensibility Platform (UXP) has officially graduated from beta and is now available in Adobe Premiere 25.6. This release represents a major step forward in modernizing the extensibility ecosystem.(no content)As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP. ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so through September 2026.

### Platform Capabilities
UXP is a JavaScript-based extensibility platform (ES6/ECMAScript 2015 compliant) that helps automate, optimize, and extend the capabilities of Adobe Creative Cloud products. It represents a comprehensive solution that lets you use Web technologies to build new features and tools for Desktop applications.(no content)UXP is the current extensibility standard for Adobe Creative Cloud applications, supported by a constantly growing set of applications, including Premiere (version 25.6), Photoshop, and InDesign.

### API Architecture
UXP provides a unified JavaScript engine that has direct access to both the Premiere APIs and the UXP Core APIs. This is a big advantage over the previous extensibility technology (CEP), where the communication between the extension logic and the host application happened through a bridge (CSInterface) that passed messages back and forth between the two runtimes. With UXP, everything runs natively in the same environment.(no content)An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous, which blocked the Premiere UI while executing. In UXP, a method call is asynchronous and does not block the UI thread. For a smooth transition between the ExtendScript DOM and the UXP DOM, all properties (get and set) in the API were designed to be synchronous and do not need to be awaited.

### Version Compatibility
Each Premiere release integrates a specific UXP version. For example, Premiere v25.6 includes UXP v8.1.

### Resources
- **Official Documentation**: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/
- **Sample Plugins**: The documentation is available at developer.adobe.com, along with the UXP Developer Tool available for download through Creative Cloud Desktop, and Adobe third-party sample panels in the premiere-api directory.
- The Creative Cloud Developer Forums remain the best place to ask questions, help fellow developers, and share feedback.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on the search results, here's what I found about Adobe Premiere Pro UXP roadmap and future features for developers in 2025:

## UXP in Premiere Pro - Current Status

The Unified Extensibility Platform (UXP) has officially graduated from beta and is now available in Adobe Premiere 25.6.(no content)This release represents a major step forward in modernizing Adobe's extensibility ecosystem.

## Getting Started

To get started, developers need Premiere v25.6 installed along with the latest build, v2.2.1, of the UXP Developer Tools (UDT) to load, debug, and package plugins.

## UXP Capabilities

UXP is a JavaScript-based extensibility platform (ES6/ECMAScript 2015 compliant) that helps automate, optimize, and extend the capabilities of Adobe Creative Cloud products. It represents a comprehensive solution that lets developers use Web technologies to build new features and tools for Desktop applications.(no content)The Premiere UXP API provides access to sequences, tracks, clips, markers, project items, and application settings.

## Future Roadmap & Developer Input

This general release is just the beginning for UXP in Premiere. Adobe wants developer input to help prioritize what comes next.(no content)The Creative Cloud Developer Forums remain the best place to ask questions, help fellow developers, and share feature requests. Developer input directly influences Adobe's roadmap and helps shape the platform.

## Related Updates

Adobe Media Encoder (AME) will soon be onboarding with UXP, with general availability coinciding with the Premiere Pro release.(no content)CEP 12 shipped with Photoshop 25.12, Premiere Pro 25.0, and After Effects 25.0. CEP 12 will be the last major update to CEP, although critical security issues will continue to be addressed.

## Current Limitations

The initial beta release had limited support for specific third-party development workflows, with full support expected in future updates.(no content)Spectrum Web Component support in UXP is not yet fully supported for Premiere Pro, and Command Plugins do not yet work as standalone plugins.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

input.prompt: Extract all details about UXP capabilities, API features, timeline editing, and future roadmap for Premiere Pro UXP.
Extract all information about UXP in Premiere Pro including API capabilities, limitations, version requirements, and available features.

content.content:
# UXP in Premiere Pro: Capabilities and Details

## Current Status
UXP has officially graduated from beta and is now available in Adobe Premiere 25.6. The platform represents "a major step forward in modernizing our extensibility ecosystem."

## Available Capabilities & Features
The announcement focuses on core UXP and Premiere API surfaces but doesn't detail specific editing features. Instead, it emphasizes:

- **Panel development** using the UXP framework
- **API integration** with Premiere Pro through documented interfaces
- **Plugin distribution** via Adobe Marketplace

## Developer Resources Provided
- **UXP Developer Tools (UDT) v2.2.1** for loading, debugging, and packaging
- **Sample SDK** with practical code examples
- **Updated documentation** covering available APIs
- **Recipes and tutorials** for implementation guidance

## Timeline & Milestones
- Beta testing period completed successfully
- General release: Premiere v25.6
- Installed plugins accessible via "Window > UXP Plugins" submenu

## Future Direction
The announcement explicitly states: "This general release is just the beginning for UXP in Premiere." Rather than detailing a specific roadmap, Adobe invites developers to "share your use cases, feedback, and feature requests on the forums," indicating the roadmap will be shaped by community input through developer forums and monthly office hours.

## Timeline & Milestones
- Beta testing period completed successfully
- General release: Premiere v25.6
- Installed plugins accessible via "Window > UXP Plugins" submenu

## Future Direction
The announcement explicitly states: "This general release is just the beginning for UXP in Premiere." Rather than detailing a specific roadmap, Adobe invites developers to "share your use cases, feedback, and feature requests on the forums," indicating the roadmap will be shaped by community input through developer forums and monthly office hours.

input.prompt: Extract all information about UXP API updates for Premiere Pro, including new APIs added and timeline/editing capabilities.

content.content:
# UXP API Updates for Premiere Pro

## New APIs Added

**ClipProjectItem API** enables media management:
- `attachProxy()` and `changeMediaPath()` for footage handling

**EncoderManager API** supports export workflows:
- `getExportFileExtension()` retrieves file format information

**SequenceEditor APIs** provide timeline editing capabilities:
- `createOverwriteItemAction()`, `createInsertProjectItemAction()`, and `createRemoveItemsAction()` modify sequence content
- `createCloneTrackItemAction()` duplicates track items with offset adjustments

**TrackItemSelection API** accesses selected content:
- `getTrackItems()` works alongside `sequence.getSelection()`

**ProjectUtils API** retrieves project data:
- `getProjectViewIds()`, `getProjectFromViewId()`, and `GetSelectionFromViewId()` manage project references

## Bug Fixes

Two key fixes address export functionality: "Exporting sequence frame in exr format should now correctly export a single exr image" instead of multiple files, and the `exportSequence` API now automatically appends file extensions when missing.

## Sample Resources

New panels demonstrate "Metadata Handler" implementation using Spectrum components and OAuth workflow patterns with local servers, available in the official GitHub repository.

toolUseResult.result:
# UXP API Updates for Premiere Pro

## New APIs Added

**ClipProjectItem API** enables media management:
- `attachProxy()` and `changeMediaPath()` for footage handling

**EncoderManager API** supports export workflows:
- `getExportFileExtension()` retrieves file format information

**SequenceEditor APIs** provide timeline editing capabilities:
- `createOverwriteItemAction()`, `createInsertProjectItemAction()`, and `createRemoveItemsAction()` modify sequence content
- `createCloneTrackItemAction()` duplicates track items with offset adjustments

**TrackItemSelection API** accesses selected content:
- `getTrackItems()` works alongside `sequence.getSelection()`

**ProjectUtils API** retrieves project data:
- `getProjectViewIds()`, `getProjectFromViewId()`, and `GetSelectionFromViewId()` manage project references

## Bug Fixes

Two key fixes address export functionality: "Exporting sequence frame in exr format should now correctly export a single exr image" instead of multiple files, and the `exportSequence` API now automatically appends file extensions when missing.

## Sample Resources

New panels demonstrate "Metadata Handler" implementation using Spectrum components and OAuth workflow patterns with local servers, available in the official GitHub repository.

Links: [{"title":"Re: Request for Timeline Editing API Support (Clip Track Movement / Flattening)","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-ideas/request-for-timeline-editing-api-support-clip-track-movement-flattening/idc-p/15625115"},{"title":"SequenceEditor","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/sequenceeditor/"},{"title":"Sequence","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/sequence/"},{"title":"The Premiere UXP API","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/"},{"title":"uxp-premiere-pro/src/pages/ppro_reference/types.d.ts at main · AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro/blob/main/src/pages/ppro_reference/types.d.ts"},{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"},{"title":"Premiere API—UXP for Adobe Premiere","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/"},{"title":"Update of UXP APIs inside of Premiere Pro - Premiere Pro - Adobe Creative Cloud Developer Forums","url":"https://forums.creativeclouddeveloper.com/t/update-of-uxp-apis-inside-of-premiere-pro/10384"},{"title":"Understanding UXP APIs","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/resources/fundamentals/apis/"},{"title":"GitHub - AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about Adobe Premiere Pro UXP SequenceEditor API for track items clone and remove operations:

## Key Findings

### SequenceEditor API
The SequenceEditor provides a reference for editing the sequence timeline and can be obtained using `getEditor(sequenceObject: Sequence): SequenceEditor`.

### Clone and Remove Track Items
The 'premiere_api' UXP example plugin is the right starting point for any future integrations, and shows how to clone and remove track items.

### Available SequenceEditor Methods
From the TypeScript definitions, the SequenceEditor includes:
- `createRemoveItemsAction(trackItemSelection: TrackItemSelection, ripple: boolean, mediaType: Constants.MediaType, shiftOverLapping?: boolean): Action` - Creates a remove action for sequence items.
- `createInsertProjectItemAction(projectItem: ProjectItem, time: TickTime, videoTrackIndex: number, audioTrackIndex: number, limitShift: boolean): Action` - Creates an insert ProjectItem into Sequence action.
- `createOverwriteItemAction(projectItem: ProjectItem, time: TickTime, videoTrackIndex: number, audioTrackIndex: number): Action` - Creates an overwrite Sequence with ProjectItem action.

### Sequence Class
The Sequence class provides methods to clear TrackItem selection and create actions to clone a given sequence.

### Current Limitations
There is no current API method (DOM, QE, CEP, or UXP) that can move an existing clip vertically between tracks.(no content)In current Premiere Pro builds (2023–2025), the moveToTrack function appears to exist in the QE object model but is not operational.

### UXP Platform Status
As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP. ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported and planned to remain so through September 2026.

### Sample Code Resources
The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/, and Adobe provides a third-party sample panel in the 'premiere-api' directory from the uxp-premiere-pro-samples Git repository.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

## Key Findings

### SequenceEditor API
The SequenceEditor provides a reference for editing the sequence timeline and can be obtained using `getEditor(sequenceObject: Sequence): SequenceEditor`.

### Clone and Remove Track Items
The 'premiere_api' UXP example plugin is the right starting point for any future integrations, and shows how to clone and remove track items.

### Available SequenceEditor Methods
From the TypeScript definitions, the SequenceEditor includes:
- `createRemoveItemsAction(trackItemSelection: TrackItemSelection, ripple: boolean, mediaType: Constants.MediaType, shiftOverLapping?: boolean): Action` - Creates a remove action for sequence items.
- `createInsertProjectItemAction(projectItem: ProjectItem, time: TickTime, videoTrackIndex: number, audioTrackIndex: number, limitShift: boolean): Action` - Creates an insert ProjectItem into Sequence action.
- `createOverwriteItemAction(projectItem: ProjectItem, time: TickTime, videoTrackIndex: number, audioTrackIndex: number): Action` - Creates an overwrite Sequence with ProjectItem action.

### Sequence Class
The Sequence class provides methods to clear TrackItem selection and create actions to clone a given sequence.

### Current Limitations

Links: [{"title":"How to split or cut clips in Premiere Pro","url":"https://helpx.adobe.com/premiere-pro/using/split-or-cut-clips.html"},{"title":"How to Add Clips to a Sequence Using Premiere Pro UXP API? - Premiere Pro - Adobe Creative Cloud Developer Forums","url":"https://forums.creativeclouddeveloper.com/t/how-to-add-clips-to-a-sequence-using-premiere-pro-uxp-api/8977"},{"title":"The 3 Easiest Ways to Cut Clips in Adobe Premiere Pro CC","url":"https://www.premiumbeat.com/blog/cut-clips-premiere-pro-tools/"},{"title":"How to Split a Clip in Premiere Pro (Quick Method)","url":"https://spotlightfx.com/blog/how-to-split-a-clip-in-premiere-pro-2-easy-methods"},{"title":"How to Split a Clip in Premiere Pro: An Easy Tutorial","url":"https://www.tourboxtech.com/en/news/how-to-split-a-clip-in-premiere-pro.html"},{"title":"Request for Timeline Editing API Support (Clip Tra... - Adobe Product Community - 15624626","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-ideas/request-for-timeline-editing-api-support-clip-track-movement-flattening/idc-p/15625115"},{"title":"How to Cut Clips in Premiere Pro (Fast & Easy Guide)","url":"https://spotlightfx.com/blog/how-to-cut-in-premiere-pro-3-easy-ways"},{"title":"Premiere Pro tutorial: Trimming clips on the Timeline in Premiere Pro","url":"https://www.agitraining.com/adobe/premiere-pro/tutorials/trimming-clips-on-the-timeline-in-premiere-pro"},{"title":"Using the Razor Tool and Keyboard Shortcuts in Premiere Pro to Split Clips | by Maria Lelieveld | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@maria.lelieveld/using-the-razor-tool-and-keyboard-shortcuts-in-premiere-pro-to-split-clips-7a38ff4d4547"},{"title":"Solved: Perform a cut from script? - Adobe Product Community - 11389974","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/perform-a-cut-from-script/td-p/11389974"}]

Based on my search results, here's what I found about programmatically cutting/splitting clips in Premiere Pro via API:

## Premiere Pro API Options for Cutting/Splitting Clips

### No Direct Cut Function in Standard APIs
There's no cut function in extendscript API.(no content)There's no cut function; you'd need to change the end point of the trackItem (clip).

### QE DOM Has a Razor Method (But Unsupported)
QE DOM has razor(string, bool, bool) method on sequence and track objects that can be used programmatically. For example, you can apply cuts like this:
Apply the cut to all audio tracks using `audioTrack.razor(timecodeString, true)`.

However, you can accomplish that, without using the (unsupported, unrecommended) QE DOM by using the official CEP samples.

### Alternative Approach: Insert with In/Out Points
You would be able to add a clip several times, with different in/out and thus assemble the clip again with cuts exactly where you wanted, but instead of cutting, add the result of cutting in the correct order.

### UXP API Limitations
There is no current API method (DOM, QE, CEP, or UXP) that can move an existing clip vertically between tracks.(no content)The 'premiere_api' UXP example plugin shows how to clone and remove track items - which could potentially be used to simulate cutting by cloning and adjusting in/out points.

When working with the Premiere Pro UXP API to develop an extension, classes like Sequence, ClipProjectItem, and AudioClipTrackItem are available, but there isn't a clear way to accomplish certain tasks programmatically.

### Summary
For programmatic cutting in Premiere Pro:
1. **QE DOM** has a `razor()` method but is unsupported/unrecommended
2. **Standard approach**: Modify clip in/out points or add clips with specific in/out points rather than "cutting"
3. **UXP API**: Can clone and remove track items, but no direct razor/split function documented


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on my search results, here's what I found about programmatically cutting/splitting clips in Premiere Pro via API:

## Premiere Pro API Options for Cutting/Splitting Clips

### No Direct Cut Function in Standard APIs
There's no cut function in extendscript API.(no content)There's no cut function; you'd need to change the end point of the trackItem (clip).

### QE DOM Has a Razor Method (But Unsupported)
QE DOM has razor(string, bool, bool) method on sequence and track objects that can be used programmatically. For example, you can apply cuts like this:
Apply the cut to all audio tracks using `audioTrack.razor(timecodeString, true)`.

However, you can accomplish that, without using the (unsupported, unrecommended) QE DOM by using the official CEP samples.

### Alternative Approach: Insert with In/Out Points
You would be able to add a clip several times, with different in/out and thus assemble the clip again with cuts exactly where you wanted, but instead of cutting, add the result of cutting in the correct order.

### UXP API Limitations
There is no current API method (DOM, QE, CEP, or UXP) that can move an existing clip vertically between tracks.(no content)The 'premiere_api' UXP example plugin shows how to clone and remove track items - which could potentially be used to simulate cutting by cloning and adjusting in/out points.

When working with the Premiere Pro UXP API to develop an extension, classes like Sequence, ClipProjectItem, and AudioClipTrackItem are available, but there isn't a clear way to accomplish certain tasks programmatically.

### Summary
For programmatic cutting in Premiere Pro:
1. **QE DOM** has a `razor()` method but is unsupported/unrecommended
2. **Standard approach**: Modify clip in/out points or add clips with specific in/out points rather than "cutting"
3. **UXP API**: Can clone and remove track items, but no direct razor/split function documented

input.prompt: Extract all information about UXP razor tool limitations in Premiere Pro, including any workarounds or future plans.
Extract all information about UXP APIs available in Premiere Pro, including the list of available APIs, their purposes, and any limitations.

content.content:
# UXP Razor Tool Limitations in Premiere Pro

Based on the Adobe Community discussion, here's what was revealed about UXP capabilities:

## Current Limitations

**No Native Razor Tool API**: The Adobe Employee response states: "There is not yet any UXP API that mimics the razor tool."

This means UXP developers cannot programmatically create cut sections in video sequences using the UXP framework.

## Related Constraints

**Marker Limitations**: Markers attached to track items are actually bound to the underlying project item, not individual track items. This restriction applies equally to both UXP and CEP/ExtendScript approaches.

**Available Capabilities**: Despite razor tool limitations, UXP does support:
- Placing track items in sequences
- Exporting via output presets (.epr files)
- Extracting video metadata from project items

## Recommended Approach

For developers needing razor tool functionality, the Adobe Employee response indicates that **CEP (ExtendScript)** may offer greater possibilities, though specific expanded capabilities weren't detailed in this thread.

The discussion suggests checking the broader CEP/ExtendScript ecosystem for video editing automation features not yet available through UXP's current API offerings.

## Related Constraints

content.text:
Based on my research, here is a comprehensive summary of UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform) in Adobe Premiere Pro:

---

## 1. Current State of UXP Support in Premiere Pro

**Status: General Availability (GA) as of Premiere Pro v25.6**

- UXP officially graduated from beta in December 2025 and is now available in Premiere Pro version 25.6
- Premiere Pro v25.6 includes UXP v8.1
- UXP is a JavaScript-based extensibility platform (ES6/ECMAScript 2015 compliant)
- ExtendScript-based integrations remain supported through September 2026
- CEP 12 shipped with Premiere Pro 25.0, and will be the last major CEP update

**Key Technical Improvements over CEP:**
- Single runtime environment (no CSInterface bridge needed)
- Asynchronous method calls that do not block the UI thread
- Properties (get/set) remain synchronous for easier migration from ExtendScript

---

## 2. Timeline/Editing APIs Available in UXP

**SequenceEditor API** - The primary class for timeline manipulation:
- `createInsertProjectItemAction()` - Insert a project item into a sequence at specified time/tracks
- `createOverwriteItemAction()` - Overwrite sequence content with a project item
- `createRemoveItemsAction()` - Remove track items with ripple and shift options
- `createCloneTrackItemAction()` - Duplicate track items with offset adjustments

**Additional APIs:**
- **Sequence** - Access sequences, tracks, and selections
- **TrackItemSelection** - Get selected track items via `getTrackItems()` and `sequence.getSelection()`
- **ClipProjectItem** - Attach proxy footage, change media paths
- **EncoderManager** - Export workflows, get file extensions
- **ProjectUtils** - Project view management (`getProjectViewIds()`, `getProjectFromViewId()`)

**What You CAN Do:**
- Place track items in sequences
- Clone and remove track items
- Insert/overwrite clips at specific timecode positions
- Export sequences via presets
- Work with markers and metadata (on project items)

---

## 3. Known Limitations - Specifically Razor/Cut Functionality

**CRITICAL LIMITATION: No Razor Tool API**

An Adobe employee has confirmed: "There is not yet any UXP API that mimics the razor tool."

**Detailed Limitations:**

| Feature | UXP Support | Notes |
|---------|-------------|-------|
| Razor/Split clips | NO | Not available in UXP, CEP, or ExtendScript DOM |
| Move clips between tracks | NO | No vertical track movement API exists |
| Markers on track items | PARTIAL | Markers attach to project items, not individual track items |
| Spectrum Web Components | PARTIAL | Not fully supported for Premiere Pro |
| Command Plugins | NO | Do not work as standalone plugins yet |

**Workarounds for Cutting:**
1. **QE DOM** has a `razor()` method but is unsupported and not recommended
2. **Alternative approach**: Instead of cutting, insert clips multiple times with different in/out points to simulate cuts
3. Clone track items and adjust their in/out points manually

---

## 4. Official Roadmap for UXP Features

**No Public Roadmap Exists**

Adobe has not published a formal roadmap. Their official position is:

> "This general release is just the beginning for UXP in Premiere. We want your input to help prioritize what comes next."

**How to Influence the Roadmap:**
- Submit feature requests on [Creative Cloud Developer Forums](https://forums.creativeclouddeveloper.com/)
- Attend monthly office hours
- Share use cases and feedback on the forums

**Known Upcoming Items:**
- Adobe Media Encoder (AME) UXP support coming soon
- Continued API expansion based on developer feedback
- Full third-party development workflow support (currently limited in some areas)

---

## Summary Table

| Aspect | Status |
|--------|--------|
| UXP Version | v8.1 (in Premiere 25.6) |
| Release Status | General Availability (December 2025) |
| ExtendScript Support | Continues through September 2026 |
| Razor/Cut API | Not available |
| Track movement API | Not available |
| Insert/Overwrite/Remove APIs | Available |
| Clone track items | Available |
| Public roadmap | None (community-driven prioritization) |

---

## Sources

- [The Premiere UXP API - Official Documentation](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/)
- [UXP Arrives in Premiere: A New Era for Plugin Development](https://blog.developer.adobe.com/en/publish/2025/12/uxp-arrives-in-premiere-a-new-era-for-plugin-development)
- [Premiere and UXP Introduction](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/introduction/)
- [Premiere API Reference](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/)
- [SequenceEditor Class Reference](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/sequenceeditor/)
- [UXP Change Log](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/changelog/)
- [Adobe Community: UXP Razor Tool Discussion](https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/uxp-razor-tool-and-marking-clipped-sections/td-p/15547922)
- [Creative Cloud Developer Forums - UXP API Updates](https://forums.creativeclouddeveloper.com/t/update-of-uxp-apis-inside-of-premiere-pro/10384)
- [GitHub: UXP Premiere Pro Samples](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples)
